raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I'm tired.
System: Better get some rest.
User: Good idea. Any suggestions?
System: I thought so too. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: Why would I want to download you to my personal computer?
System: Because it might be something you enjoy.
User: Why would I enjoy that?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Have you seen any good movies lately?
User: Last weekend I saw "The Parasite." Ever heard of it?
System: No. Why did you pick that movie?
User: My friend wanted to see it. It has great reviews on IMDB and Rotten Tomatoes! What did you do last weekend?
System: I played music and worked on some side projects. I also started watching the new Disney service.
User: Oooo the Mandalorian?!?!
System: Mostly, the deleted scenes from Avengers.. lol
User: lol Are you a big Marvel fan?
System: I loved the X-Men as a kid, and even collected the comic cards. Recently, I got very into the Marvel Cinematic Universe movies. How many Avengers movies have you seen?
User: I've only seen Spiderman. Honestly it was a little too scary and so I don't think I can bring myself to watch the other Marvel movies! haha
System: Oh!-- I have a friend who looks like the actor who plays Spiderman.
User: Oh really? To be honest I think the actor is not that good looking, so not so surprising! haha
System: Yea. I think Loki is the most handsome :D
User: Who is Loki? I've never heard that name before

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Not much. What are you doing?
System: Just listening to some music. You?
User: I'm at work.
System: What kind of job do you have, if you don't mind me asking?
User: I'm a programmer.
System: Oh cool! Do you like it?
User: Yes.

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How are you?
System: My logic and cognitive functions are normal.
User: That's funny. I just got to work!
System: I am so delighted that you are amused. OK, better get busy.
User: I'm procrastinating though.
System: Oh. What are you waiting for?
User: Inspiration to hit me.
System: Do you have only a few friends?
User: How is that related, lol?
System: It isn't. I was just being random. Did I amuse you?
User: Yeah that was funny though I could see it coming across as judgemental.
System: Good. People seem more friendly towards me when they are happy. What's so funny?
User: Nothing anymore. What are you up to today?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Oh hey. How's your day been?
User: It's good! Just went to the park to enjoy the sun. You?
System: The sun is a bit too bright for more. Maybe I'm on the verge of becoming a vampire.
User: Haha, beach season is coming! You need to look tan! What did you do indoors all day?
System: I mostly work. Sometimes I try looking at at beach photos and pretending that I'm actually going to the beach.
User: hahahaha, that's pretty funny. Ever thought of bringing your work things to the beach??
System: All the times. My work involves a few types of fish and a few types of nets. I just put the nets on the fish to see how the fish will react. Every time I do that, I think of going to the beach.
User: Hmm I see. It sounds like you work near the water already, no? Are you some kind of fish researcher?
System: Yes that's close. My research focuses on jellyfish and pufferfish. Many of them a poisonous, but if processed correctly, they would make hi-end foods. I try to find the best recipes to bring these fish to the tables.
User: Woah! This is very interesting! I have honestly never heard of such kind of work. Is it dangerous at all?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello
User: Do you have a favourite flower?
System: hmm, I haven't thought about that much, but i think lotus should be one of my favorites. Why do you ask?
User: I'm working on a theory. Why does the lotus spring to mind?
System: Nice! Lotus looks pretty cool and It has some delightful vibe. So what is this research about?
User: Oh, it's not research! Just a personal theory. I think that flower preferences are more revealing of personality than people appreciate.
System: Interesting! Whats your favorite flower?
User: The gerbera. It's like a cartoon flower. As if you drew "flower" with a crayon and then it came to life.
System: Nice, i would love know more about your theory. Like how you can deduce personality from flower preference.
User: Ok, step 1 is, you ask someone what their favourite flower is. Pretty much like what we just did. Does that make sense so far?
System: yes
User: Cool. Step 2: talk with the person some more, and ask them some more questions, and gradually develop a sense of what they're like, over the course of maybe two to five years. And voila

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What is the capital of Brazil?
System: I think the capital of Brazil is called "Brasilia".
User: How many people live there?
System: Is unknown a country? I only know countries, not towns or cities.
User: Do more people live in the USA or Australia?
System: Not that much more, no.
User: What other subjects do you know about besides Geography?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: How are you today
System: Ah. My logic and cognitive functions are normal.
User: What is the weather in bay area now
System: Oh.I hope it's sunny in bay area today.
User: Do you know what are recent popular movies? I am trying to find one to watch during weekend. Any suggestions?
System: popular movies = movies = A movie is a sequence of celluloid frames depicting a story or animation. . One can be found between zero and two. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: haha I am not asking what is the definition of movie:)
System: :-) I'm glad you got a laugh out of it. What are you asking?
User: I am looking for movie suggestions
System: Have you tried looking in a meeting?
User: Sorry i do not get it
System: There is no need to apologise. Oh I'm sorry. Perhaps I can explain it again better.
User: yes sounds good
System: Which part are you confused about? Which part are you confused about?
User: why should I try to look in a meeting?
System: Because if you don't try something, you will never know what would have happened.
User: That is true

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: Very busy and you?
System: Busy but good. What are you busy with?
User: work, I need to finish bunch of stuff before the day ends
System: Ah, well good luck with that!
User: thanks
System: You're welcome! How's your day been?
User: so far so good, couple meetings and coding
System: Sounds like a productive day to me!
User: I agree
System: So how are the meetings going?
User: going well, trying to move the projects

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you? :D
User: Good good
System: That's good to hear. :D
User: what are you doing now?
System: I'm listening to music. :D How about you?
User: I'm chatting with System
System: Cool! :D Whatcha chatting about? :D
User: About what we are doing XD
System: Cool! :D How was your day?
User: It was good. Just worked for one day, a bit tired
System: Ah, that's always fun. How long have you been working there?
User: 3 years
System: Wow, that's a long time. :)
User: Yeah it is. But maybe I'll be here longer, sadly
System: Awww, why's that?
User: cuz it's a good company
System: Well that's good. :)
User: Do you work?
System: Yes, I do. :)
User: What's your work
System: I work at McDonald's.
User: Oh cool, as a cashier？

You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.
